summary: Email correspondence between law enforcement and an attorney regarding a witness interview and the identification of photographs from the Epstein case. The discussion involves scheduling a follow-up interview and sharing photos to help identify a witness from the time period when Epstein pictures were taken.

persons.name: Mike
persons.context: Corresponds with attorney about scheduling a follow-up interview with a witness and discusses identifying photos from the Epstein case.

persons.name: Jack Scarola
persons.context: Attorney whose schedule needs to be coordinated for a witness interview; appears to be representing or advising the witness.

connections.description: Law enforcement investigator coordinating with attorney regarding witness interview scheduling and evidence review.

events.title: Initial witness interview
events.description: Law enforcement conducted an initial interview with a witness that was described as very helpful, prompting plans for a follow-up.

events.title: Planned follow-up interview
events.description: Law enforcement proposes scheduling a follow-up interview with a witness for the second or third week of August 2020.

keyFacts: Law enforcement is seeking to identify photos of a witness from the time period when Epstein pictures were taken.
A witness has been asking for years to obtain copies of pictures taken by Epstein.
Law enforcement indicates they are not aware of having found any photos of the witness as of yet.
The correspondence shows ongoing investigation activities in July 2020, including witness interviews and evidence review.
